settings.right_content_02:
African Ancestry helps people across the Diaspora reclaim the legacy of their past to discover the greatness in themselves.

It's in your DNA

settings.video_sub_title: Watch as the daughter of Lauryn Hill and Rohan Marley learns her maternal ancestry.
Explore this place that serves as a symbol of our strength and resilience.
Howard alumni share how their identities were transformed by their HBCU experience.
Watch as Jeremy Ellis 6th generation descendant of shipmates of the Clotilda learns his paternal ancestry.
This powerful video highlights the importance of the Clotilda and Africatown in the Black experience worldwide.

Watch as Sean Gibson and Melva Brown learn more about Josh Gibson's African maternal ancestry. Josh was an American Negro league baseball catcher known by historians as one of the very best power hitters and catchers in the history of any league, including MLB.
This month we celebrate Afro-Cuban identity and culture by honoring Latin Music Legend Celia Cruz. PART I introduces us to Ms. Celia Cruz through her nieces Celia Cody and Linda Pritchett.
PART II of our focus on Latin Music Legend Celia Cruz reveals the present-day African country and ethnic group that shares her maternal ancestry.

settings.video_title: The African Influence on Cuba's Rumba Music
settings.video_sub_title: Rumba is a secular genre of Afro-Cuban music involving dance, percussion and song. It’s full of energy, powerful and hypnotizing. The music is unapologetically derived from its West African roots, with percussion music weaved into up-tempo rhythms. The Rumba was traditionally performed by poor workers of African descent on the streets and in courtyards using wooden boxes that were eventually replaced by conga drums. Today, Rumba remains one of Cuba's most characteristic forms of music and dance.

settings.sub_title_video_section: From the people who have paved the way to the places that inspire us to the spaces that have become sacred, come with us on the journey.

settings.content_03: With experts in Psychology, Economics, History, Science and the Arts, we explore how our identities are impacted by various historical, cultural and social frameworks, and how we can use this knowledge to build a stronger self and community.

settings.content-box_01: Remembering Who You Are begins with finding your roots!

settings.our_story_sub_title: African Ancestry is a company that helps expand the way Black people view themselves and the way they view Africa!
settings.our_story_content:
Founded in 2003 by Dr. Rick Kittles and Gina Paige, African Ancestry is the world leader in tracing maternal and paternal lineages of African descent having helped more than 1,000,000 people re-connect with the roots of their family tree. With the industry’s largest and most comprehensive database of over 30,000 indigenous African DNA samples, African Ancestry determines specific countries and specific ethnic groups of origin with an unrivaled level of detail, accuracy and confidence. African Ancestry is committed to providing a unique service to the black community by working daily to improve the cultural, emotional, physical, spiritual and economic wellbeing of people across the African Diaspora.

Subscribe to our Newsletter

Get stories & special offers from Dr. Gina Paige and Guests

settings.founder_designation:
CO-FOUNDER & PRESIDENT, AFRICAN ANCESTRY, INC.
INDUSTRY PIONEER, SPEAKER, ENTREPRENEUR
settings.founder_about:
PIONEER: In 2003, Dr. Gina Paige co-founded African Ancestry, Inc. (AfricanAncestry.com) and in doing so, pioneered a new way of tracing African lineages using genetics, and a new marketplace for people of African descent looking to more accurately and reliably trace their roots. Paige travels the world helping people demystify their roots and inform on identities so that they may better understand who they are by knowing where they’re from.

RESPECTED LUMINARY: Paige has worked with and revealed the roots of the world's leading icons and entities including Oprah Winfrey, John Legend, Chadwick Boseman, Spike Lee, Condoleezza Rice and The King Family. Paige has served as speaker, presenter and/or partner to McDonalds, Capital One, The Walt Disney Company, Booz Allen Hamilton, Wells Fargo, The Wall Street Health Forum, New York Times Travel Show, United Healthcare and dozens of community organizations and faith-based entities. She’s often a go-to resource for African Diaspora communities including the Embassies of Cameroon and Ghana; The Year of Return 2019 event From Jamestown to Jamestown with the NAACP; Back2Africa Festival in Cape Coast and various African tourism authorities and leaders.

MEDIA RESOURCE: Paige has been featured in hundreds of media outlets including The Breakfast Club, Hot 97-FM, Time Magazine, USA Today, 60 Minutes, NewsOne Now with Roland Martin, HuffPost Live with Marc Lamont Hill, The Joe Madison Show, Sister Circle Live, Essence Magazine, The New York Times, The Tom Joyner Morning Show, FOX Business News, Reuters, New York Times, Canal Media Company, Black Enterprise, Ebony, NPR, Metro Source Urban Radio, American Urban Radio Networks, The Grio.com and TheRoot.com among many others. Her work is featured in PBS’ Finding Your Roots with Henry Louis Gates, Jr. and African American Lives 1 & 2, The Africa Channel, NBC’s Who Do You Think You Are?, CNN’s Black in America series and SiriusXM where she created and served as co-host on African Ancestry Radio.

ENTREPRENEURIAL DNA: From a lineage of entrepreneurs, Paige launched her first business at age 8, with a magazine purposed to raise money for an amusement park visit. She went on to start “Pik-A-Pak” Care Packages as a Stanford University graduate, helping families stay connected with their children while away at school. Prior to forming AfricanAncestry.com, Paige was the founder and president of GPG Strategic Marketing Resources.

EDUCATION: Paige resides in Washington, D.C. and holds a degree in Economics from Stanford University and an MBA from the University of Michigan Ross School of Business. Paige was honored with an Honorary Doctor of Philosophy from Global Oved Dei Seminary University.

settings.founder_designation:
CO-FOUNDER & SCIENTIFIC DIRECTOR, AFRICAN ANCESTRY, INC.
INDUSTRY PIONEER, LEADING GENETICIST, ENTREPRENEUR, SPEAKER
settings.founder_about:
PIONEERING RESEARCHER: Dr. Rick Kittles is Co-founder and Scientific Director of African Ancestry, Inc. It is through his years of research on genetic variation and his passion for the movements of African people throughout the world that AfricanAncestry.com was conceived. In 2003, Dr. Kittles and along with Co-founder Dr. Gina Paige pioneered a new marketplace for Black people looking to know where they’re from in Africa. Under Kittles’ leadership, African Ancestry has grown into the leading provider of at-home genetic ancestry tests for people of African descent across the world.

DNA MATCHMAKER: A leading geneticist, Dr. Kittles oversees AfricanAncestry.com’s DNA matching and results function. Using the company’s proprietary African Lineage Database along with close collaboration with historians, anthropologists and linguists, Dr. Kittles safeguards accuracy and integrity in determining African countries of origin and Tribes. African Ancestry’s African DNA database remains the largest and most comprehensive ever collected, making its lineage matching the most reliable in the marketplace.

LEADING GENETICIST: Dr. Kittles is very active in the field of human genetics and genetic anthropology, particularly as it relates to complex disease and health disparities in African Americans. Dr. Kittles’ research interests explore DNA, family history, and disease. Dr. Kittles is an international leader on race and genetics, health disparities, and cancer genetics. His work on tracing the genetic ancestry of African Americans has brought to focus many issues, new and old, which relate to race, ancestry, identity, and group membership.

Currently, he is Professor and Founding Director of the Division of Health Equities within the Department of Population Sciences at City of Hope. He is also Associate Director of health equities in the Comprehensive Cancer Center.

SUBJECT MATTER EXPERT: Dr. Kittles’ work at African Ancestry has ignited global interest and dialogue, as well as unprecedented focus on African ancestry tracing in U.S. and abroad. His work has been featured on BBC, PBS, CNN, CBS 60 Minutes, Ebony, NPR and USA TODAY, as well as hundreds of local and trade media across the world. He has published in medical journals and consumer books on genetic variation, race and culture, prostate cancer and health disparities.

Kittles received a Ph.D. in Biological Sciences from George Washington University. As an Assistant Professor at Howard University in 1997, Dr. Kittles helped establish a national cooperative network to study the genetics of hereditary prostate cancer in African Americans. He also served as Co-Director of Molecular Genetics in the National Human Genome Center at Howard University.

settings.how_it_works_title: TRACE YOUR DNA FIND YOUR ROOTS.
settings.how_it_works__sub_title: Using the power of DNA and the most comprehensive database of indigenous African genetic sequences in existence, African Ancestry is the ONLY company that can trace your ancestry back to a specific present-day African country and ethnic group of origin dating back more than 500 years ago. If the results are from another continent, that information will be provided.

settings.title: YOUR DNA
settings.sub_title: Depending on which test you purchase, we analyze either the mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) that you inherited from your mother, the Y chromosome that men inherit from their fathers or autosomal DNA that you inherit from both parents. A simple swab from inside your cheek is all we need to begin the process.

settings.title: YOUR FAMILY TREE
settings.sub_title: You share information within the genes we extract that is unchanged through every branch of your family tree. In other words, we identify the unique fingerprint that you share with your parents, grandparents, great-grandparents and so on along a single lineage.

settings.title: YOUR HISTORY
settings.sub_title: Utilizing pioneering genetic scientific methods, we look closely for markers or mutations that indicate where in the world your ancestry is found. If your genes indicate Africa, we then compare them to the world’s largest database of African lineages to determine the present-day African country and ethnic group with which you share maternal or paternal ancestry.

settings.title: YOUR ROOTS
settings.sub_title: Discovering your roots is an important and truly emotional experience. Once your ancestry has been determined, we provide information about your country of origin so that you can begin to re-connect with your roots. We also provide access to an exclusive online community of others who have also started the journey to find their true identity.

settings.how_it_works__sub_title: We each carry in our DNA a series of indicators that provide information about our ancestry. This information is passed from generation to generation and can tell a profound story about where we come from, and highlight our connections to modern-day Africa.

settings.how_it_works__title: Your genetic information is kept completely confidential. Every sample is identified by a bar code and the lab destroys the sample upon completion. No personal information is shared with or sold to any third parties.

settings.product_description:
With our MatriClan™ Test Kit, a simple swab will reveal your African country of origin and ethnic group on your mother’s maternal line. Our test reveals your mother’s maternal roots from 500 - 2,000 years ago.

The MatriClan™ Test traces maternal ancestry by analyzing the mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) women and men inherit exclusively from their mothers. Men AND women can take this test.

In fact, you share the same mtDNA as your mother, grandmother, great grandmother and so on. Therefore, your results are the same for your siblings, maternal aunts and uncles, maternal cousins, etc.

Your results are also the same for your children and your daughter’s children.
settings.link_title: See which family members share your maternal results

settings.product_description:
With our PatriClan™ Test Kit, a simple swab will reveal your African country of origin and ethnic group on your father’s paternal line. Our test reveals your father’s paternal roots from 500 - 2,000 years ago.

The PatriClan™ Test traces paternal ancestry by analyzing the Y chromosome men inherit exclusively from their fathers.

Since only men carry a Y chromosome, women CANNOT take the PatriClan™ Test. But luckily, women may trace their paternal lineage by having a male relative from their father’s side take the test for them.

The results of his PatriClan™ Test will be the same for his father, grandfather, children, siblings, brother’s children, paternal aunts and uncles, etc.
settings.link_title: See which family members share your paternal results

settings.faq-question: How are African Ancestry’s tests different from other ancestry tests.
settings.faq-answer:
• Our tests place your African ancestry in a present-day country and ethnic group or tribe.
  • We use the largest number of African DNA samples in the industry to analyze your ancestry.
  • We do not maintain a database of customer information.
  • We do not sell or share customers’ personal or genetic information.
  • We do not provide customer information to law enforcement.
  • We do not biobank your genetic material. All genetic material is destroyed at the lab.
  • We analyze mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) and Y Chromosome DNA. We do not use autosomal DNA.

settings.faq-question: If I have results from another company’s test, can I send them to you for analysis?
settings.faq-answer: Yes. If your mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequence or your Y-chromosome markers have African ancestry, we can tell you what present-day country(ies) and ethnic groups in Africa that they share ancestry with. Please click here for data requirements. We cannot use data from admixture analyses.

settings.faq-question: How reliable are the tests?
settings.faq-answer: For lineage-based tests, reliability depends on several things such as the size of the database, the sampling of the lineages and the accuracy of lineage matches. Our database is the most comprehensive resource of African lineages available. We have worked with historians, archeologists, anthropologists and other geneticists to build the  largest collection of African lineages  in the world. We use a Sequence Similarity Score (SSS) measure to determine matches. The SSS measure is a likelihood estimate based on the frequency of identical and closely related (>99%) haplotypes. It is our degree of confidence in your results. Dr. Kittles explains here.

settings.faq-question: How accurate are the MatriClan and PatriClan Tests?
settings.faq-answer: Our results are highly accurate. For about 85% of the people we test we find identical matches in our database. For the remaining people, we find closely related lineages with greater than 95% confidence. Our database is the most comprehensive resource of African lineages available.

settings.faq-question: What can I expect from an African Ancestry test?
settings.faq-answer:
Our tests do not provide percentages. We tell you WHERE in Africa one branch of your family tree goes back to, not HOW MUCH African ancestry you have.

The MatriClan Test traces the ancestry of ONE branch of your family tree, mother to mother to mother on back, for the past 2,000 years.

The PatriClan Test traces the ancestry of ONE branch of your family tree, father to father to father on back, for the past 2,000 years.

settings.faq-question: How can I determine my paternal ancestry if I am a woman?
settings.faq-answer: In order for a woman to determine her paternal ancestry, she must use the Y-chromosome of a male on her father's side—her brother, father, father's brother, grandfather, etc. Click here for help with reviewing your lineages.

settings.faq-question: Can the PatriClan Test determine paternity?
settings.faq-answer: No. The PatriClan Test is not a paternity test.

settings.sub_title: Here are some commonly asked questions about the African Ancestry Experience:

settings.faq-question: How do the test kits work?
settings.faq-answer:
Our tests place your African ancestry in a present-day country and ethnic group or tribe. For

other ancestries, we report an mtDNA haplogroup and/or geographic region.

 

  • We use the largest number of African DNA samples in the industry to analyze your ancestry.
  • We do not maintain a database of customer information.
  • We do not sell or share customers’ personal or genetic information.
  • We do not provide customer information to law enforcement.
  • We do not biobank your genetic material. All genetic material is destroyed at the lab.
  • We analyze mtDNA and Y Chromosome. We do not use autosomal DNA.

settings.faq-question: If I have results from another company’s test, can I send them to you for analysis?
settings.faq-answer: Yes. If your mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequence or your Y-chromosome markers have African ancestry, we can tell you what present-day country(ies) and ethnic groups in Africa that they share ancestry with. Please click here for data requirements. We cannot use data from admixture analyses.

settings.faq-question: What if I lose my Kit ID#?
settings.faq-answer:
The Kit ID# is found on the Kit packaging and on the Activation card inside of the kit.

The Kit ID# protects your confidentiality. Therefore, you must provide your Kit ID# in order to get any information from us about your kit status.

You must activate your Kit. If you send your swabs to us WITHOUT activating your kit AND lose your Kit ID#, we will be unable to locate any information about your sample.

No refunds will be provided if you lose your Kit ID#. Your order number and email are not the same as the Kit ID#. They do not provide access to Test Taker information.

settings.faq-question: How reliable are the tests?
settings.faq-answer:
For lineage-based tests, reliability depends on several things: the size of the database, the sampling of the lineages and the accuracy of lineage matches.

Our database is the most comprehensive resource of African lineages available. We have worked with historians, archeologists, anthropologists and other geneticists to build the largest collection of African lineages in the world.

We use a Sequence Similarity Score (SSS) measure to determine matches. The SSS measure is a likelihood estimate based on the frequency of identical and closely related (>99%) haplotypes. It is our degree of confidence in your results. Dr. Kittles explains here.

settings.faq-question: How accurate are the MatriClan and PatriClan Tests?
settings.faq-answer: Our results are highly accurate. For about 85% of the people we test we find identical matches in our database. For the remaining people, we find closely related lineages with greater than 95% confidence. Our database is the most comprehensive resource of African lineages available.

settings.faq-question: What can I expect from an African Ancestry test?
settings.faq-answer:
Our tests do not provide percentages. We tell you WHERE in Africa one branch of your family tree goes back to, not HOW MUCH African ancestry you have.

The MatriClan Test traces the ancestry of ONE branch of your family tree, mother to mother to mother on back, for the past 2,000 years.

The PatriClan Test traces the ancestry of ONE branch of your family tree, father to father to father on back, for the past 2,000 years.

settings.faq-question: How can I determine my paternal ancestry if I am a woman?
settings.faq-answer: In order for a woman to determine her paternal ancestry, she must use the Y-chromosome of a male on her father's side—her brother, father, father's brother, grandfather, etc. It cannot be her son.

settings.faq-question: Is there some way to trace the ancestry of a family member that has died?
settings.faq-answer: The easiest way to trace the ancestry of a deceased family member is to identify a living relative with the same lineage. Give us a call to discuss your options.

settings.faq-question: What are you going to do with my DNA?
settings.faq-answer: African Ancestry will analyze your DNA for ancestry. Your DNA will be destroyed once a result is determined. We do not sell or share our customers' personal, genetic or financial information.

settings.faq-question: Will my DNA results be kept confidential?
settings.faq-answer: Please click here to review our Terms and Conditions.

settings.faq-question: What are the instructions for taking the test?
settings.faq-answer: Please click here to review the Test Kit Instructions.

settings.faq-question: What does the results package look like?
settings.faq-answer:
Test results are accessible through an online portal and include:

  • MatriClan official result has HVS1, HVS2 and HVS3 designations and mtDNA haplogroup. African results also include present-day African country and ethnic group.
  • PatriClan official result has ancestral country(ies), YSTR markers and YAP (Y-alu polymorphism). African results also include African ethnic group(s).

All results also include:

  • Certificate of Ancestry
  • E-book Guide to African History and Cultures
  • Access to our exclusive African Ancestry Online Community on Facebook
  • Online trainings with company founders and staff

settings.faq-question: How long does it take to get my results?
settings.faq-answer: The estimated timeframe for results is 10-12 weeks after receipt of your swabs. This is not a guarantee.

settings.faq-question: Can you tell what tribe I am from?
settings.faq-answer: We will tell you if you share ancestry with one of the 400 ethnic groups in our database. There is the rare chance where we can find an African country but are unable to determine the ethnic group. There is also the chance that your result will not be African.

settings.faq-question: Can you estimate how many generations back my lineage goes?
settings.faq-answer: We do not estimate dates for the lineages since there is a large standard error involved in those estimates. The timeframe of our analysis is 500 – 2,000 years.

settings.faq-question: I have several different ancestries. Can your test tell me about my European and/or Native American ancestries?
settings.faq-answer: Our tests will only tell you about the lineage for which you submit DNA, maternal or paternal. We do not analyze your entire genome and provide a percentage breakdown of different ancestries. We provide mtDNA haplogroups. We do not provide Y Chromosome haplogroups.

settings.faq-question: What if you do not find any match for my ancestry?
settings.faq-answer: If we do not find a match for your ancestry anywhere in the world, we will notify you by mail. We will keep your sequence on file and re-run it against future updates to our database. Or you can choose to receive a refund. WE DO NOT OFFER REFUNDS FOR NON-AFRICAN RESULTS.

settings.faq-question: Can the PatriClan Test determine paternity?
settings.faq-answer: No. The PatriClan Test is not a paternity test.

settings.faq-question: What is your Refund Policy?
settings.faq-answer: Our refund policy can be found here: https://africanancestry.com/policies/refund-policy

settings.faq-question: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.faq-answer:
Our goal is to process and fill orders received by 12 PM CST in the same business day, Monday - Friday. Orders placed 12 PM CST on Friday and on weekends, will be shipped on the following business day. We commit to shipping your order within three business days of receipt.

We cannot control the shipping carriers. Shipping times are estimates and depend on the shipping method that you select at checkout. A tracking number is provided for all packages.

settings.faq-question: What is a Kit ID#? What happens if I lose my Kit ID#?
settings.faq-answer:
The Kit ID# protects your confidentiality. Therefore, you must provide your Kit ID# in order to get any information from us about your kit status. Keep your Kit ID# someplace where you can access it.

The Kit ID# can be found in two places: on the back flap of the black envelope and on the Activation Card inside of the kit.

If you send your swabs to us WITHOUT activating your kit AND lose your Kit ID#, we won't be able to locate any information about your sample. You will not receive your results. You will not receive a refund.

Your order number and email are not the same as the Kit ID#. They do not provide access to Test Taker information.

settings.faq-question: What should I do if I have misplaced my kit or swabs?
settings.faq-answer: We will replace a lost kit within 90 days and you will incur a $25 replacement charge. f you return swabs for a test kit purchased more than 90 days ago, you are subject to a reactivation fee. See Section 11 of the Terms and Conditions.

settings.faq-question: What is Affirm?
settings.faq-answer:
Affirm is a financing alternative to credit cards and other credit-payment products. Affirm offers instant financing for online purchases to be paid in fixed monthly installments over 3, 6, or 12 months. For example, on a $700 purchase, you may pay $63.18 for 12 months with a 15% APR.

Your rate will be 0%-36% APR based on credit, and is subject to an eligibility check. Payment options through Affirm are provided by these lending partners: affirm.com/lenders. Options depend on your purchase amount, and a down payment may be required

You must discuss any Affirm payment concerns directly with them at (855) 423-3729.

settings.faq-question: I purchased Route shipping insurance. If my package is lost, stolen, or damage, how can I file a claim?
settings.faq-answer:
Please review the filing requirement below and contact Route to file your claim at https://claims.route.com

If you are not able to successfully file a claim and you would like a refund or a replacement kit, we will assess a reactivation/restocking fee.

Filing Requirements
  • Claims for packages presumed to be lost by the carrier, where the status is “not delivered” must be filed no sooner than 7 days after the scheduled delivery date for domestic shipments (and 20 days for international shipments), but not later than 30 days from the date the shipment was originally scheduled to be delivered.

  • All other claims for loss or damage should be filed as soon as discovered but in no event later than 60 days from the purchase date.

  • Claims for packages marked by the carrier as “delivered” yet not received by the customer must be filed within 5 days from the date and time shown by carrier as delivered. Underwriters reserve the right to require proof of either a copy of a police report showing report of theft or security video recording showing evidence of theft.

settings.faq-question: How is an AAFR different than other trips?
settings.faq-answer: African Ancestry Family Reunions are specially curated all-inclusive birthright journeys. They are authentic, culturally immersive experiences co-created by experienced professionals in the country. We have partnered with Tourism ministries, local communities, businesses and cultural organizations and embassies, to create an unforgettable reconnection to your family’s ethnic group.

settings.faq-question: Are AAFRs open to the public?
settings.faq-answer: The trips are open to African Ancestry Family Members (who have taken a MatriClan or PatriClan Test) and their extended family.

settings.faq-question: Is airfare included in the price?
settings.faq-answer: Yes. The AAFR price is all-inclusive. It includes airfare from Washington, DC, 4-5 star lodging, meals, ground transportation in country and scheduled activities.

settings.faq-question: Why can't I see the trip details?
settings.faq-answer: You will only see the trip details once you enter a valid Kit ID and/or the email you used to activate your kit.

settings.faq-question: Where do I find my Kit ID?
settings.faq-answer: The Kit ID# can be found in several places: on the back flap of the black envelope, on the Activation Card inside of the kit, on your results letter and in your online account. Please email your request to identify your lost Kit ID# to info@africanancestry.com.

settings.faq-question: How much is the AAFR?
settings.faq-answer: You will only see the trip details once you enter a valid Kit ID and/or the email you used to activate your kit.

settings.faq-question: Is there a payment plan?
settings.faq-answer: We offer Affirm and PayPal as payment options.

settings.faq-question: Are AAFRs open to children?
settings.faq-answer: Yes.

settings.faq-question: What is the refund policy?
settings.faq-answer: AAFRs are non-refundable. However, you may apply your payment to any future trip within one year of your original trip date.

settings.faq-question: Can I attend an AAFR even if my ancestry was not found in that country?
settings.faq-answer: Yes. As long as you an African Ancestry Family member, you can attend any AAFR you choose.

settings.title: The African Ancestry Identity Box
settings.content: Curated treasures to celebrate your African identity

settings.selecttitle: Learn what they didn’t teach you
Have fun with your entire family

settings.title: Dive in…
settings.content:
to remember who you are
to discover more about where you came from
to explore the riches of your heritage

settings.title: Open and Learn
settings.content: With fun activities, commissioned artwork and educational tools, the African Ancestry Identity Box helps you celebrate the very essence of who you are.
Interactive exercises and journal topics to spark conversation and expand your knowledge of Africa
52-card set from our cousins at Urban Intellectuals with stories of Black achievement (Pre-1942)
cards from top chefs across the Diaspora showcasing dishes that are rooted in African heritage
Postcards showcasing artists within the African Ancestry Family to remind us of our identity and culture
Personal space for all your notes and reflections—customize your pages with the Identity Stickers included
Enamel pin with DNA strand and discount code on your next maternal and/or paternal ancestry test kit

settings.title: What’s In The Box
settings.bottomcontent: The African Ancestry Identity Box is waiting for you to explore your ancestry.

settings.title: Reclaim Your Legacy.
settings.content: Use African Ancestry to reconnect with your long-lost tribe. Start with our easy and secure in-home Genetic Test Kits.

settings.title: Do Something Different
settings.content: Send flowers and a MatriClan Kit this Mother's Day.

settings.flowers-selecttitle: Learn the African tribe of your maternal ancestors
Share the results with everyone on your maternal line
Support companies led by Black women

settings.flowers-title: Lee’s Flower and Card Shop & African Ancestry
settings.flowers-content: We’re honored to partner with Lee’s Flower and Card Shop, the oldest Black-owned flower shop in Washington DC.  Sisters Stacie Lee Banks & Kristie Lee are continuing the legacy of their grandparents that began on U Street 75 years ago. As Mother’s Day approaches, I think of their grandmother and how proud she must be.
settings.flowers-second-content: My mother’s garden was planted among the Fulani women in Nigeria over 2000 years ago. Her beautiful garden flourished for centuries when one day -- her blossoms were ripped away and the seeds scattered in places all over the world. As the only Black woman to own a genetic ancestry tracing company, I am a proud example of their strength and resilience.
settings.flowers-third-content: Your maternal ancestor lives in you … find out where she’s from.

settings.slide_secondary_title: By Black People, For Black People
settings.slide_copy:
Knowing where you're from is a critical component of knowing who you are. Find those missing pieces of your identity with this
transformative and powerful experience.

settings.hero_content: African Ancestry is the only genetic ancestry company that puts your identity, safety and privacy first. We destroy 100% of your DNA samples. Plus, we DO NOT sell or share your genetic information.

settings.text_content: We do not sell or share your personal information.
We never provide your data to law enforcement.
We do not bio-bank your genetic material.

settings.tribe_sub_text_2: Great project for the whole family

settings.tribe_sub_text:
Largest database of
African genetic sequences

settings.tribe_sub_text_2: We destroy 100% of your DNA samples & DO NOT sell or share your genetic info.

settings.how_it_works_home_text: As the pioneers of genetic ancestry tracing for Black people globally, we can reconnect you to your specific African roots–the country and the people. Our strength is based on owning the world’s largest and most comprehensive database of African DNA.

settings.product_below_image: Includes everything you need to trace your mtDNA, submit your cheek swab and receive your digital results.
Includes everything you need to trace your Y-DNA, submit your cheek swab and receive your digital results.
Includes both test kits, six personalized Certificates Of Ancestry and four country of origin tees.

settings.identity_your_legacy_text: Track the status of your test
Discover your genetic sequence and information such as haplogroups
Find your country and tribe of origin with our Certificate Of Ancestry
Learn about your ancestors with our “Guide to African History and Cultures”
Share your results with other family members
Get exclusive access to our Facebook Community
Expand the way you see yourself
Create a legacy for future generations

settings.identity_your_legacy_sub_title: The African Ancestry experience is a powerful and transformative experience.

settings.easy_secure_painless_text: You or a family member takes a simple cheek swab and sends it back to us.
We analyze your DNA, compare it to our database, then destroy your sample.
We determine your present-day country and ethnic tribe in Africa.
Then share your results with other family members on the same lineage.
Learn why you might receive a result that is not African.

settings.remember_who_you_are_text: From the people who have paved the way to the places that inspire us to the spaces that have become sacred.
settings.remember_who_you_are_sub_content: This the moment you find your greatest power.

settings.left_content: When your DNA sample is submitted to the lab, no personal information is provided. It is only identified by a barcode maintained by African Ancestry.
settings.right_content: Once your DNA sequence has been analyzed, all generic material including additional cheek swabs are destroyed at the lab.

settings.video_title: Chadwick Boseman On Taking The "Right Test"
Q-Tip Connects With Jola Ekonting Musicians
The Sister Circle Reconnects With Their Ancestors

settings.title: Testimonials
settings.testimonial1: African Ancestry is a requirement. I loved the results that I got on my African ancestry. It showed that my mothers family was originally from Cameroon. I shared the information with my entire family.
settings.testimonial2: Best Purchase I Made! This test was easy to do and the best purchase I made for myself in a long time! There is nothing like being able to say that you ARE “African-American.” And you know where your people originate from. I highly recommend this test as its the gift that keeps on giving with knowledge of self and knowledge for your family.
settings.testimonial3: Totally Worth It! It’s a simple process from beginning to end. Although it takes time to get your results, they remain in communication with you periodically to let you know you are not forgotten. My results impacted me and my entire family. I am a Black Woman in America and I KNOW WHO I AM.

settings.content_title: Find The Missing Piece of Your Identity
settings.content_paragraph: Our science team will compare your DNA markers to the largest African reference database in the world in order to find your African origin up to 2000 years ago

settings.title: About the Founders
settings.content: In 2003, Dr. Rick Kittles along with Dr. Gina Paige. took his years of research on genetic variation and his passion for the movements of African people throughout the world to create a new way for people across the Diaspora to reconnect with Africa and find their lost heritage.

settings.info_text: We destroy 100% of your DNA samples. We DO NOT sell or share your genetic testing information or DNA test results.

settings.title: Your DNA
settings.description: Depending on which test you purchase, we analyze either the mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) that you inherited from your mother, the Y chromosome that men inherit from their fathers or autosomal DNA that you inherit from both parents. A simple swab from inside your cheek is all we need to begin the process.

</svg>

settings.title: Your Family Tree
settings.description: The genetic information we extract remains unchanged across every branch of your family tree, forming an unbroken link through generations. In essence, we uncover the distinctive fingerprint that you share with your ancestors, from parents and grandparents to great-grandparents and beyond, along a single lineage.
settings.slider_images:

</mask>

</svg>

settings.title: Your History
settings.description: Utilizing pioneering genetic scientific methods, we look closely for markers or mutations that indicate where in the world your ancestry is found. If your genes indicate Africa, we then compare them to the world’s largest database of African lineages to determine the present-day African country and ethnic group with which you share maternal or paternal ancestry.
settings.slider_images:
<svg width="200" height="200">
 <mask id="svgmask-slider">
<circle fill="#ffffff" cx="100" cy="100" r="140"></circle>
</mask>
<image xlink:href="https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/2138/0103/files/image_48.png?v=1681364960" mask="url(#svgmask-slider)"></image>
</svg>

settings.subtitle_text: We each carry in our DNA a series of indicators that provide information about our ancestry. This information is passed from generation to generation and can tell a profound story about where we come from, and highlight our connections to modern-day Africa.

settings.content_title: What you get with your test
settings.content_paragraph: Your mtDNA has power. It provides energy for every cell in your body. mtDNA also has a series of unique markers that tell a profound story about you and your family.
settings.what_you_get_list:
• Your present-day African country and ethnic group, if your result is African.
  • Dual Citizenship Eligibility (if your results are found in Sierra Leone)
  • Personalized Certificate Of Ancestry
  • HVR1, HVR2 and HVR3 (hypervariable region) designations and mitochondrial haplogroup.
  • “Guide to African History and Cultures” e-book.
  • Exclusive access to Online Community on Facebook.
settings.protected_account_text: You’ll activate your kit online and receive your results through a password protected account, which will allow you to track and view your results package securely and confidentially.

settings.product_template_about_your_roots_head: We Get Specific About Your Roots
settings.product_template_about_your_roots_text: Unlike other companies, African Ancestry uses the largest database of African genetic sequences to pinpoint your ancestral roots.

settings.product_template_text: Start your journey of self-discovery, reconnect to Africa, learn your family history, and unlock your power within.

settings.connection_title: It’s A Connection To Your Past, Present And Future
settings.connection_paragraph: Women are the backbone of any society and hold the power to create life. Over the course of history, many were stripped of their heritage and humanity, yet they survived to ensure one day we would thrive. Find your roots and your power.

settings.african_ancestry_text: Transform the way you see yourself: by black people, for black people
Identifies your present-day African country of origin

settings.choose_african_ancestry_title: better. bolder. blacker choose african ancestry

settings.faqs_content: African Ancestry is a 100% Black-owned business founded in 2003 by Dr. Rick Kittles and Gina Paige. You can learn more about us here.

settings.faqs_title: What's the likelihood of receiving a result that is not African?
settings.faqs_content: Ninety-two percent (92%) of the people who take this test receive an African result. There is an 8% chance that your result will not be African.

settings.faqs_title: Why might someone receive a result that is not African?
settings.faqs_content: Very few, if any, African Americans are 100% African. During the period of slavery in the Americas, white men (slave traders, slave owners, etc.) often fathered children with enslaved women. Their offspring then had both African and European ancestry. This means that the descendants of the offspring will have a European branch in their family tree. There is an 8% chance that your maternal ancestry result will not be African.Read more about why here.

settings.faqs_title: Can I send results from another company's test for analysis?
settings.faqs_content:
Maternal Ancestry Results

Yes, if you have a mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequence and an mtDNA Haplogroup L from another company, then your MatriClan Test result will be African.
If it is not Haplogroup L, then do not take the MatriClan Test. If it is, please click here to submit an Analysis Only request.

Paternal Ancestry Results
Yes, if you have Y-chromosome markers and a Y Haplogroup of A, B or E from another company, then your PatriClan Test result will be African.
If it is not a Y Haplogroup of A, B or E, then do not take the PatriClan Test. If it is, please click here to submit an Analysis Only request.

Admixture/Autosomal Results
No, we cannot use autosomal data from another company. However, please check your results to see if the company gave you an mtDNA haplogroup or Y chromosome haplogroup. We can provide better direction if you have that data. Contact us at info@africanancestry.com.

In accordance with our Terms and Conditions, African Ancestry does not refund MatriClan Tests, PatriClan Tests or Family Packages after swabs have been received at the lab. International customers are responsible for the postage to return swabs to us. You can read our refund policy here.

settings.product_template_lasting_legacy_head: A Lasting Legacy For Your Whole Family
settings.product_template_lasting_legacy_text: Your results apply to everyone who shares your maternal lineage.

settings.faqs_content: The MatriClan DNA Test is extremely accurate and easy to use. Simply collect a DNA sample from inside your cheek and send it back to the laboratory for analysis. We analyze the mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) that you inherited from your mother, which traces the maternal line. When your test results are ready, you’ll be able to log in to your account. If your result is African, you’ll see your African country and ethnic group of origin.

Our African genetic sequence database is 15 times larger than any other ancestry company. We guarantee the complete destruction of your DNA samples. Our company, founded by individuals of African descent, aims to provide the best DNA test kit for the African American community.

92% of people who take the MatriClan test receive an African result. There is an 8% chance that your result will not be African.

Keep in mind no refunds will be given once swabs are received at the lab. International customers are responsible for the postage to return swabs to us.

settings.sub_text: Discover your mother's maternal roots with mtDNA.
settings.testimonial_text: I can’t wait to go to Bioko Island … to have the sun in that part of the region on my body and know that I’m home!

Otherwise, package will include "African Ancestry" Tees. After receiving your results, you will receive a form to select your t-shirt countries and sizes and certificate names.
African Ancestry is the only genetic ancestry company that puts your identity, safety and privacy first. We destroy 100% of your DNA samples. We DO NOT sell or share your genetic information.

No refunds will be given once swabs are received at the lab. International customers are responsible for the postage to return swabs to us. International orders will be responsible for shipping costs of t-shirts and certificates.

settings.content_title: What you get with this package
settings.content_paragraph: Anyone can take the MatriClan Test. Only those assigned male at birth can take the PatriClan Test. Your test kits include instructions, swabs and a postage-paid return envelope.
settings.protected_account_text: You’ll activate your test kit online and receive your results through a password protected account, which will allow you to track and view your results package securely and confidentially.

settings.product_template_text: Start your journey of self-discovery, reconnect to Africa and unlock your power within.

settings.connection_paragraph:
With six additional Certificates Of Ancestry and six country of origin t-shirts included, plus additional certificates and tees available for purchase, the Family Celebration Package is a great project and gift for the entire family.

  • Throw an ancestry reveal party to share your results, certificates and tees
  • Research and share historic and cultural stories about your tribe
  • Find recipes and enjoy foods from that country
  • Make travel plans or find other ways to connect with the Motherland

settings.faqs_title: Why might you receive a result that is not African?
settings.faqs_content: Very few, if any, African Americans are 100% African. During the period of slavery in the Americas, white men (slave traders, slave owners, etc.) often fathered children with enslaved women. Their offspring then had both African and European ancestry. This means that the descendants of the offspring will have a European branch in their family tree. There is an 8% chance that your maternal ancestry result will not be African. Read more about why here.

settings.faqs_title: Can I send results from another company's test for analysis?
settings.faqs_content:
Paternal Ancestry Results

Yes, if you have Y-chromosome markers and a Y Haplogroup of A, B or E from another company, then your PatriClan Test result will be African. If it is not a Y Haplogroup of A, B or E, then do not take the PatriClan Test. If it is, please click here to submit an Analysis Only request.

Maternal Ancestry Results

Yes, if you have a mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) sequence and an mtDNA Haplogroup L from another company, then your MatriClan Test result will be African. If it is not Haplogroup L, then do not take the MatriClan Test. If it is, please click here to submit an Analysis Only request.

Admixture/Autosomal Results

No, we cannot use autosomal data from another company. However, please check your results to see if the company gave you an mtDNA haplogroup or Y chromosome haplogroup. We can provide better direction if you have that data. Contact us at info@africanancestry.com.

settings.product_template_lasting_legacy_head: A Lasting Legacy For Your Whole Family
settings.product_template_lasting_legacy_text: Your results apply to everyone who shares your maternal lineage.

settings.faqs_content: The PatriClan Test Kit is easy to use. Simply collect a DNA sample inside your cheek and send it back to the laboratory for analysis. When your results are ready, you’ll be able to log in to your account. If your result is African, you’ll see your African country and ethnic group of origin.

Our database of African genetic sequences is at least 8X larger than that of any other ancestry tracing company.
We destroy 100% of your DNA samples.
We're founded by Black people for Black people.

The PatriClan Test Kit is the most accurate way to determine your African ancestry. 65% of test takers get an African result.

Keep in mind no refunds will be given once swabs are received at the lab. International customers are responsible for the postage to return swabs to us.

settings.title: Your History
settings.description: By harnessing groundbreaking genetic scientific methods, we delve deep into the secrets of your ancestry. Our meticulous search for markers and mutations reveals the precise origins of your lineage across the globe. If Africa emerges from your genetic makeup, we embark on a thrilling journey, comparing your genes to the vast repository of African lineages. The result? We unveil the present-day African country and ethnic group with whom you share a remarkable maternal or paternal heritage.

settings.subtitle_text: Embedded within our DNA lies a collection of markers that hold invaluable insights into our ancestral heritage. These remarkable indicators, passed down through generations, weave a captivating narrative of our origins and illuminate our profound ties to contemporary Africa.

settings.content_title: What you get with your test
settings.content_paragraph: The Y Chromosome is paternally inherited. It is passed from father to son over many generations. The Y Chromosome has a series of unique markers that tell a profound story about your paternal line.

• Your present-day African country and ethnic group, if your result is African.
  • Dual Citizenship Eligibility (if your results are found in Sierra Leone)
  • Personalized Certificate of Ancestry
  • YSTR Alleles and YAP
  • “Guide to African History and Cultures” e-book.
  • Exclusive access to Online Community on Facebook.

settings.faqs_content:
• Module 1

    In this module, we define identity, talk about group and personal identities and our identity in the context of family.

  • Module 2

    This module covers types of records, research challenges and preservation methods used in genealogy research.

  • Module 3 – Part I

    This module provides a solid understanding of the types of DNA.

  • Module 3 – Part II

    This module demonstrates how DNA is used in single lineage and autosomal tests.

  • Module 4

    This module covers various aspects of the genetic ancestry testing process.

  • Module 4a

    This module breaks down how DNA databases are used to determine ancestry.

  • Module 4b

    This module explains the analysis process used for genetic ancestry testing.

  • Module 5

    This module demonstrates ancestry in action with exclusive video content.

• Course Study Guide
  • Resource List
  • Glossary
  • Bonus Video Content
  • Special Offer
  • Transcripts

• People who want to fully understand how genetic ancestry tests work.
  • People who may think that all companies are the same.
  • People who want to understand the differences between types of ancestry tests.
  • People who are curious about their African roots but don’t understand the science.

Once you complete your purchase, you will receive an email from “ANCESTRY TRACING 101”. There will be a link to register on the platform, Searchie.io. Be sure to check your spam folder if you do not see an email.

settings.sub_text: A Roadmap To Finding Your African Roots
settings.testimonial_text: This course is perfect for people thinking about [genetic ancestry] testing or those needing to understand the type of test they took.

settings.info_text: We destroy 100% of your DNA samples. We DO NOT sell or share your genetic information.

settings.faqs_content: The course consists of 8 modules. The average length of a module is under 10 minutes.

settings.faqs_title: How do I access the course?
settings.faqs_content: Once you complete your purchase, you will receive an email from “ANCESTRY TRACING 101”. There will be a link to register on the platform, Searchie.io. Be sure to check your spam folder if you do not see an email.

settings.faqs_title: How long will I have access to the course?
settings.faqs_content: Your purchase gives you lifetime access to the course.

settings.faqs_title: Who do I contact if I have questions about the course?
settings.faqs_content: We welcome your questions and feedback. Please contact our team at courses@africanancestry.com

settings.faqs_title: What topics does the course cover?
settings.faqs_content: The course covers Identity, Genealogy, DNA, Genetic Ancestry Testing and Ancestry in Action. It also contains a downloadable, fillable Study Guide PDF,  other resource materials and bonus content.
